article:
'Extraordinary rendition' or 'irregular rendition' is the apprehension and
extrajudicial transfer of a person from one country to another. Michael John Garcia, Legislative Attorney American Law Division.
[http://www.fas.org/sgp/crs/natsec/RL32890.pdf "Renditions: Constraints Imposed
by Laws on Torture"], 8 September 2009; link from the United States
[http://www.counterterrorismtraining.gov/leg/index.html Counter-Terrorism
Training and Resources for Law Enforcement web site] During the United
States war on terror under the administration of President George W. Bush, the
term became associated with US practices of transferring suspects for
interrogation in countries known to employ torture.
categories: Counter-terrorism policy of the United States
